designSystemProfile.name: Corporate & Professional Education Landing Page
designSystemProfile.description: A design system for a professional and modern landing page, likely for educational or business services, featuring a clean layout with strong calls-to-action.

primary.description: A vibrant green used for primary calls-to-action, conveying success and growth.

secondary.description: A dark, almost black, used for the main background, providing a professional and serious tone.

accent.description: White, used for text and highlights to contrast with the dark background.

neutral.description: A range of grays for form backgrounds, borders, and placeholder text to create a soft, clean interface.

families.primary: Sans-serif (e.g., 'IBM Plex Sans Arabic', 'Tajawal', or a similar modern Arabic font)
families.secondary: Sans-serif (e.g., 'Inter', 'Roboto', or 'Open Sans' for Latin characters)

heading1.description: Large, bold headings for major titles.

heading2.description: Slightly smaller headings, used for form titles.

body.description: Standard text for paragraphs and descriptions.

spacing.description: A consistent spacing scale is used for padding, margins, and layout gaps, creating a balanced and organized look.

iconography.description: Icons are used sparingly and have a clear purpose, such as indicating input field types.

layout.description: A common hero section layout with a visually dominant content area on one side and a conversion-focused form on the other. The layout uses a subtle, flowing background shape to divide the sections.

inputField.style: Minimal with a bottom border or a very light background.

form.shadow: Large, diffused shadow to lift it off the background.

statCounter.style: Large number with a descriptive label below it.
statCounter.description: Used to showcase key metrics and build social proof.

keyPrinciples: High Contrast: Use dark backgrounds with light text to create a strong visual hierarchy and a premium feel.
Clear Call-to-Action: The primary button should be the most vibrant element on the page to draw user attention.
Generous Spacing: Don't crowd elements. Use ample whitespace and defined spacing to guide the eye and improve readability.
Focus on Conversion: The form is a central piece of the design. It should be clean, easy to use, and visually distinct.
Trust Signals: Use statistics and clear, professional language to build credibility with the user.
implementationNotes: The flowing background divider can be implemented as an SVG for scalability.
Ensure font choices support both the Latin and Arabic scripts if targeting a multilingual audience.
Implement clear focus states on all interactive elements for accessibility.
